concept.label: England under-21 international footballer
concept.definition:
"England Under-21 International Footballer" (noun):

1. A footballer who is officially selected and participates in football matches for England's national under-21 team. The age restriction implies the player is at most 21 years old, although they can still play if they turn 22 during the two-year European Championship campaign.
   
2. Typically, these players are recognized as having significant potential in the sport, and may either be emerging talents in the early stages of their professional careers or established players within the football leagues.

3. The selection of these players is based on their skill, performance, and adherence to the rules and regulations set by the Football Association, the governing body of football in England. 

4. Their primary objective is to represent England in international under-21 football competitions, such as the UEFA European Under-21 Championship. 

5. Being an England under-21 international footballer often serves as a stepping stone to being selected for England's senior national team.

data.label: Garry Parker
data.description: Garry Parker (born September 7, 1965 in Oxford) is a renowned English footballer and manager. He is recognized for his contributions as a midfielder, and has played for several clubs including Luton Town F.C., AC Omonia, Nottingham Forest F.C., Hull City A.F.C., Leicester City F.C., and Aston Villa F.C. He has also represented the England national under-21 football team and the England national football B team. Parker has made significant contributions in the Premier League and was a player in the FA Cup Final. As a manager, he has led Leicester City F.C. and managed the team during the 2001-02 season. Standing at a height of 1.8034m, Parker has also been affiliated with the Leeds Rhinos. He is also known by the alternate names of "Parker", "G. Parker", and "Gordon Parker".
data.rationale: The assertion that Garry Parker is an England under-21 international footballer can be supported by the information provided in the description of the entity. According to the description, Garry Parker has represented the England national under-21 football team. This aligns with the definition of an England under-21 international footballer, which states that it is a footballer who is officially selected and participates in football matches for England's national under-21 team. Therefore, based on the information provided, Garry Parker fits the definition of an England under-21 international footballer.

Notably, he has competed for both England's and Republic of Ireland's national under-19 football teams. Bamford is of Irish descent and has been recognized as a top Premier League goal scorer. Therefore, based solely on the provided information, we cannot definitively categorize Patrick Bamford as an England under-21 international footballer.

data.label: Paul Gascoigne
data.description:
Paul Gascoigne (also known as "Gazza") is an English former professional footballer and football manager, born on May 27, 1967, in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. He is best known for his time with clubs like Tottenham Hotspur F.C., Everton F.C., Newcastle United F.C., S.S. Lazio and Rangers F.C. Internationally, Gascoigne played for the England national football team and was a participant in the 1990 FIFA World Cup. 

Gascoigne also had a stint as a manager for Kettering Town F.C. and has been involved in various controversies, leading to his conviction for several crimes. He has been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and obsessive-compulsive disorder, and has been a victim of the News International phone-hacking scandal.

Gascoigne has also authored autobiographical works, and has been featured in films like "Bobby Robson: More Than a Manager", "Gascoigne", and "One Night in Turin". His spouse is Sheryl Gascoigne and he is related to Regan Gascoigne.
data.rationale: The provided description does not provide sufficient information to argue that Paul Gascoigne is an England under-21 international footballer. While it is stated that Gascoigne played for the England national football team and participated in the 1990 FIFA World Cup, there is no specific mention of him playing for England's under-21 team. Therefore, based solely on the provided information, it cannot be asserted that Paul Gascoigne is an England under-21 international footballer.

data.label: Chris Woods
data.description:
Chris Woods, born on November 14, 1959 in Sheffield, Yorkshire, South Yorkshire, Lincolnshire, and Swineshead, Lincolnshire, is a retired professional football player and coach. He played as a goalkeeper and stands 1.88 meters tall. Throughout his career, he played for multiple teams including the England national under-21 football team, Reading F.C., Sunderland A.F.C., Scotland national football team, Queens Park Rangers F.C., Southampton F.C., Rangers F.C., England national football team, Nottingham Forest F.C., Sheffield Wednesday F.C., Colorado Rapids, Burnley F.C., and Norwich City F.C. 

Woods featured in several major football tournaments such as the 1986 and 1990 FIFA World Cups, UEFA Euro 1988 and 1992, and was a part of the UEFA Champions League winning team. He also played in the Scottish Football League, English Football League, Premier League and Major League Soccer (MLS), where he was a foreign player. In addition to his playing career, Woods also served as a football goalkeeping coach and reportedly coached the Scotland national football team. He has also been associated with lower division clubs and was recognized as an England international footballer. Besides his football career, Woods is also noted as a musical artist.
